gurmukhi: ਨਿਰਖ ਲੋਗ ਅਦਭੁਤ ਬਿਸਮੲੇ ॥ ਦਾਨਵ ਪੇਖ ਸੂਰਛਨ ਭੲੇ ॥
transliteration: Nirakh Log Adbhout Bismae|| Daanav Pekh Moondchhan Bhae||
translation: Seeing this, al the people were wonder-struck and visualizing such a huge form of Vishnu, the demons became unconscious.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਵ ਪਤਾਰ ਛੁਯੋ ਸਿਰ ਕਾਸਾ ॥ ਚਕ੍ਰਤ ਭੲੇ ਲਖਿ ਲੋਕ ਤਮਾਸਾ ॥੨੧॥
transliteration: Paav Pataar Chhuyo Sir Kaasaa|| Chakrat Bhae Lakh(i) Lok Tamaasaa||21||
translation: The feet of Vishnu touched the nether-worlds and the head touched the heavens; all were non-plussed on seeing this.21.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕੈ ਪਾਵ ਪਤਾਰਹ ਛੂਅਾ ॥ ਦੂਸਰ ਪਾਵ ਗਗਨ ਲੳੁ ਹੂਅਾ ॥
transliteration: Ekai Paav Pataarah Chhodhaa|| Doosar Paav Gadan Lau Hooaa||
translation: With one step, he measured the nether-world and with the second step he measured the heavens.

gurmukhi: ਭਿਦਯੋ ਅੰਡ ਬ੍ਹਮੰਡ ਅਪਾਰਾ ॥ ਤਿਹ ਤੇ ਗਿਰੀ ਗੰਗ ਕੀ ਧਾਰਾ ॥੨੨॥
transliteration: Bhidyo And Brahmand Apaaraa|| Tih Te Girigadg Kidhaaraa||22||
translation: In this way, Vishnu touched the whole universe and the current of Ganges began to flow down from the whole universe.22.

gurmukhi: ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਭੂਪ ਅਚੰਭਵ ਲਹਾ ॥ ਮਨ ਕ੍ਰਮ ਬਚਨ ਚਕ੍ਰਤ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਰਹਾ ॥
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Bhoop Achanndhav Lahaa|| Man Kram Bachanndchakrat Hvai Rahaa||
translation: In this way, the king was also astonished and remained puzzled in mind, word and deeds.

gurmukhi: ਸੁ ਕਛੁ ਭਯੋ ਜੋੳੂ ਸੁਕ੍ਰ ੳੁਚਾਰਾ ॥ ਸੋ ਅਖੀਯਨ ਹਮ ਅਾਜ ਨਿਹਾਰਾ ॥੨੩॥
transliteration: Su Kachh(u) Bhyo Jooo Soukra Ouchaaraa|| So Akheeyan Ham Aaj Nihaaraa||23||
translation: Whatever Shukracharya had said, the same had happened and he himself had seen all this with his own eyes on that day.23.

gurmukhi: ਅਰਧਿ ਦੇਹਿ ਅਪਨੌ ਮਿਨ ਦੀਨਾ ॥ ੲਿਹ ਬਿਧਿ ਕੈ ਭੂਪਤ ਜਸੁ ਲੀਨਾ ॥
transliteration: Ardh(i) Deh(i) Apnau Min Deenaa|| Eh Bidh(i) Kai Bhoopat Jas(u) Leenaa||
translation: For the remaining half a step, the king Bali got measured his own body and earned approbation.

gurmukhi: ਜਬ ਲੳੁ ਗੰਗ ਜਮਨ ਕੋ ਨੀਰਾ ॥ ਤਬ ਲੳੁ ਚਲੀ ਕਥਾ ਜਗ ਧੀਰਾ ॥੨੪॥
transliteration: Jab Laudgadg Jamanndko Neeraa|| Tab Lau Chalikathaa Jag Dheeraa||24||
translation: As long as there is water in the Ganges and Yamuna, till that time the story of his time the story of this enduring king will be narrated.24.

gurmukhi: ਬਿਸਨ ਪ੍ਰਸੰਨਿ ਪ੍ਰਤੱਛ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਕਹਾ ॥ ਚੋਬਦਾਰੁ ਦੁਅਾਰੇ ਹ੍ਵੈ ਰਹਾ ॥
transliteration: Bisan Prasann(i) Pratachchh Hvai Kahaa|| Chobdaar(u) Dudare Hvai Rahaa||
translation: Vishnu was then pleased and manifesting himself said; “O king; I shall be a watchmen and servant at your gate myself;

gurmukhi: ਕਹਯੋ ਚਲੇ ਤਬ ਲਗੈ ਕਹਾਨੀ ॥ ਜਬ ਲਗ ਗੰਗ ਜਮੁਨ ਕੋ ਪਾਨੀ ॥੨੫॥
transliteration: Kahyo Chale Tab Lagad Kahaanee|| Jab Lag Gadg Jamounndko Paanee||25||
translation: And as long as there will be water in the Ganges and Yamuna, the story of your charity will be narrate.25.
